Core Data Collection & Transport.description: Provides the foundational framework for data collection, session management, privacy controls, and reliable data transport that powers all browser monitoring capabilities, including efficient data compression.

files.description: This README.md file describes the purpose of the remote configuration schema located in this directory. It notes that this schema is a duplicate of a version found in an internal repository.
Defines the `Context` interface and related types (`ContextValue`, `ContextArray`) for representing and serializing flexible, hierarchical key-value data.
This file provides a function to display an error message when a Datadog SDK (RUM or Logs) is initialized more than once, unless configured to silently ignore such multiple initializations.

This file contains unit tests for the `displayAlreadyInitializedError` function, verifying its behavior when a library is initialized multiple times, including scenarios where error display is suppressed.

This file contains unit tests for the `defineGlobal` function, verifying its behavior in defining and redefining properties on a global object, including the execution and error handling of queued callbacks.
This file defines and initializes the public API for a Datadog SDK. It sets up the global SDK object, manages versioning, and processes any queued commands from asynchronous loading.

This file serves as the main entry point for the core Datadog Browser SDK package, re-exporting essential types, utilities, and functionalities from various sub-modules. It aggregates components for configuration, error handling, session management, telemetry, browser interaction, and general tools.
This file contains unit tests for the tag building utilities, verifying that tags are correctly constructed from configuration and that appropriate warnings are issued for invalid or malformed tags.

This file contains unit tests for the `configuration` module, specifically validating the `validateAndBuildConfiguration` function which processes and validates the SDK's initialization configuration.

This file defines the configuration schema for the Datadog Browser SDK, including types for privacy levels, trace context injection, and the comprehensive `InitConfiguration` interface with various options for data collection, session management, and transport.

This file serves as an index for the core configuration domain of the browser SDK, exporting types, interfaces, and utilities for application configuration, API endpoint building, and data transport settings.

This file contains unit tests for the `contextManager` module, verifying its functionality for managing context data, including setting, getting, updating, clearing, enforcing types, and notifying subscribers of changes.
This file provides utility functions for validating context objects, specifically the 'checkContext' function which verifies if an input is a valid context.

This file defines a context manager responsible for storing, retrieving, and modifying a key-value context, ensuring properties are properly sanitized and validated according to defined configurations.
Manages and synchronizes a specific product's context data with local storage, enabling persistence and real-time updates across browser tabs or windows.
This file defines constants and types for customer data categories, context keys, and context management methods within the Datadog browser SDK.
This file contains unit tests for the `checkContext` utility function, ensuring it correctly validates various context objects and handles invalid inputs as expected.

This file contains unit tests for the `storeContextManager` module, verifying its functionality for persisting and synchronizing context data with local storage. It ensures proper handling of context updates, storage events, and segregation of data based on product keys and customer data types.
This file provides utility functions for working with `ContextManager` instances, including wrapping methods with monitoring and telemetry, and buffering context changes for later application.

This file contains unit tests for the `globalContext` module, verifying its behavior in managing global context data, including how it integrates with hooks and its persistence across page navigations.
This file is responsible for initializing and managing a global context, including its persistence across page loads and its integration with other system components via hooks.

This file contains unit tests for the `accountContext` module, verifying its functionality in managing, sanitizing, and persisting account information, including its interaction with event assembly and cross-page storage.

This file defines the structure for account-related information (`Account` interface) and provides utilities to manage this context. It initializes an `AccountContextManager` to store and retrieve account data, which can be persisted across pages and is integrated into the SDK's data assembly process.
Tests the user context management functionality, including property sanitization, integration with event assembly hooks, and persistent storage across page loads based on configuration.
This file manages the user context, providing functionalities to identify users and their properties (e.g., ID, email, name, anonymous ID) and integrating this context into SDK events and telemetry.
This file dynamically loads and initializes Datadog RUM and Logs SDKs from specified CDN URLs, using configurations and contexts provided via the global `window` object.

This file initializes Datadog RUM and Logs SDKs for a browser extension test application. It configures and sets global contexts for RUM and Logs based on predefined values available in the window object.
This README file describes the `core` package of the Datadog browser SDK, which provides core utilities.
This file provides utility functions to check for specific browser environments and features, such as identifying Firefox or checking for adopted stylesheets support.
This file provides utility functions to execute a callback or resolve a promise when the document's `readyState` reaches a specific state (interactive or complete).

This file declares standard browser-related types like VisualViewport, WeakRef, and CookieStore, which are backported from the official TypeScript DOM library to support an older minimal TypeScript version used in the project.

This file contains unit tests for the `getZoneJsOriginalValue` function, verifying its ability to retrieve the original, unpatched value of an object's property even when Zone.js is active and potentially patching methods.
This file contains unit tests for the custom `setTimeout` and `setInterval` implementations, ensuring they function correctly, handle errors, and interact as expected with the clock and Zone.js.
This file provides a utility function to retrieve the original, unpatched value of a DOM API or function, circumventing modifications made by Zone.js to ensure reliable behavior.
This file provides robust and prefixed logging utilities for the SDK by safely accessing original browser console methods, and exports relevant documentation links.

This file contains unit tests for the `requestIdleCallback` utility, verifying its functionality, fallback mechanism when the native API is unavailable, and its shimmed implementation for deferring non-essential tasks.
This file provides a utility function to queue a microtask, using the native `queueMicrotask` API or a Promise-based fallback, and ensures the executed callback is monitored.

This file provides wrapped versions of native timer functions (setTimeout, setInterval, clearTimeout, clearInterval) to ensure callbacks are monitored and to handle potential interference from libraries like Zone.js by retrieving original global values.

This file defines the `Encoder` interface, which specifies how to encode data synchronously or asynchronously, and provides a factory function (`createIdentityEncoder`) for a basic, pass-through string encoder.
This file provides utility functions for working with byte-related operations, including calculating the byte size of strings and concatenating Uint8Array buffers.

This file provides utilities for handling different time representations (e.g., timestamps, relative times, durations) and converting between them, along with functions for calculating time drifts and managing navigation start times in a browser environment.
This file contains unit tests for the `sanitize` utility function, covering its behavior with various data types, objects, circular references, `toJSON` methods, and size constraints.

This file contains tests for the `jsonStringify` utility function, verifying its behavior across various scenarios, including how it handles `toJSON` methods on objects and prototypes, as well as edge cases and serialization errors.

Provides a custom JSON stringification utility that temporarily detaches or ignores problematic `toJSON` methods from objects and prototypes to ensure reliable serialization, especially in environments where `toJSON` might be badly overridden.

This file provides a `sanitize` function designed to prepare user-provided data for serialization, ensuring it is 'safe' for the SDK. It handles deep cloning, removes cyclic references, transforms unserializable types into string representations, and enforces a maximum character count.

This file provides utilities for building, validating, and sanitizing tags based on the SDK's configuration. It ensures tags adhere to size limits and character restrictions before being sent to the backend.

This file contains unit tests for the `connectivity` module, verifying its ability to accurately report network status, interface types, and effective connection types based on `navigator.onLine` and `navigator.connection` properties.
This file serves as the main entry point for the 'connectivity' module, re-exporting all declarations from './connectivity'.

This file provides an API to determine the browser's network connectivity status, including network type and effective speed. It defines types and a function to retrieve current connection information.
This file contains unit tests for the `createEventRateLimiter` function, verifying its behavior in limiting events over time and triggering a callback when the limit is reached.

This file implements a rate limiter for events, preventing more than a specified number of events of a given type from occurring within a one-minute window. It provides a function to create a limiter that triggers a callback when the event limit is exceeded.

This file provides utility functions for detecting if the SDK is running within a browser extension environment, specifically checking for extension-related URL prefixes in window locations or error stacks.

This file provides utilities and constants for detecting and retrieving specific values related to Datadog Synthetics tests, such as test IDs, result IDs, and RUM injection status, from global browser properties or cookies.
This file contains a function to determine if the current browser environment supports the necessary features for the R RUM SDK to operate correctly.
This file contains tests for the `limitModification` function, which ensures that an object's properties can only be modified according to a specified set of rules and allowed paths.
This file defines common data types and interfaces used across different domains of a monitoring application, including dashboard metrics, logs, APM traces, infrastructure, and user settings.
This file provides a utility function to create a fake session storage strategy, primarily used for mocking and testing session management logic within the browser SDK.

This file contains unit tests for the `getCurrentSite` function, which is responsible for extracting the effective top-level domain + 1 from a hostname or URL. It verifies various domain formats, edge cases, and caching behavior of the function.
This file provides utility functions for managing browser cookies, including setting, getting, deleting, and determining cookie authorization and the effective site domain.

This file contains unit tests for the `trackingConsent` module, specifically verifying the functionality of `createTrackingConsentState` for managing user tracking consent states, including initialization, updates, and notification mechanisms.

This file contains unit tests for the `isAllowedTrackingOrigins` function, verifying its behavior in different scenarios, particularly concerning origin validation based on configured allowed tracking origins and the execution environment (browser extension or regular page).

This file defines types and a utility for managing and tracking user consent for data tracking, including states like 'granted' or 'not-granted' and providing an observable to notify of consent changes.

This file provides a function to determine if the SDK is permitted to track data based on the current window origin and the configured `allowedTrackingOrigins` list. It handles cases for web extension environments and general origin matching.

This file contains unit tests for the `sessionManager` module, covering functionalities like session creation, tracking type management, cookie handling, session renewal mechanisms, and behavior across multiple session manager instances.
Defines constants and types related to session management, including timeout/expiration delays and session persistence mechanisms for the browser SDK.
This file defines utilities and a regular expression for validating session strings, checking their format and structure.

This file contains unit tests for the utility functions that manage and transform session state objects, ensuring they correctly identify session states (started, expired, not started) and handle serialization/deserialization.

This file manages user sessions, providing mechanisms to store, retrieve, and update session states across different storage strategies (cookie, local storage, memory). It ensures session synchronization and handles session lifecycle events like renewal and expiration.
This README documents the lifecycle and state transitions of a session within the browser SDK, detailing how sessions are managed, updated, and expire under various conditions and user interactions.

This file contains unit tests for the old cookie migration logic in the browser SDK. It verifies that old session, RUM, and logs cookies are correctly migrated to the new session cookie format and that existing cookies are not affected.

This file contains unit tests for the session store, specifically focusing on the `selectSessionStoreStrategyType` function and its behavior with various session persistence configurations (cookie, local storage, memory, and fallback mechanisms).
This file manages operations on the session store, coordinating updates across potentially multiple browser tabs using a locking mechanism to prevent race conditions and ensure data consistency.

This file implements the session manager, responsible for creating, renewing, and expiring user sessions based on user activity, tracking consent, and persistence strategies. It also handles session state updates and provides mechanisms to track session changes and report unexpected states.
This file defines the `SessionState` interface and provides functions for managing, validating, and serializing/deserializing session states within the browser SDK.

This file contains logic to migrate session data from older cookie formats (e.g., `_dd`, `_dd_r`, `_dd_l`) to the current session storage strategy used by the Datadog browser SDK. It ensures backward compatibility when upgrading from older SDK versions.

This file contains unit tests for the session store operations logic. It verifies how sessions are managed (read, updated, persisted) and thoroughly tests the concurrency control mechanisms, including locking and retries, to ensure robust session handling.

This file contains unit tests for the in-memory session storage strategy, verifying its functionality including session persistence, retrieval, expiration, immutability, and shared state across different strategy instances.

This file implements a session storage strategy that uses the browser's local storage to persist, retrieve, and expire user session states. It includes utilities to verify local storage availability and initialize the storage operations.

This file defines the interfaces and types for different session storage strategies, detailing how session data can be persisted, retrieved, and expired using various mechanisms like cookies or local storage.

This file contains unit tests for the `sessionInCookie` module, which implements a session storage strategy using browser cookies. It verifies the persistence, retrieval, expiration, and cookie option building logic under various configurations, including anonymous user tracking.

This file contains unit tests for the session storage strategy that uses browser local storage. It verifies the functionality of persisting, retrieving, expiring, and handling session data within local storage.

This file implements the cookie-based strategy for persisting user session information in the browser, including logic for building cookie options, storing, retrieving, and expiring session data, and handling potential cookie option encoding.
This file implements a session storage strategy that keeps the session state in the browser's global memory. It enables different SDKs (e.g., RUM and Logs) to share a single in-memory session.

This file contains unit tests for the `serializeAttributes` module, which handles the serialization of DOM element attributes for recording in the Datadog RUM browser SDK, focusing on privacy levels and masking sensitive data.
This file provides an observable to detect changes in a specific browser cookie, utilizing the `cookieStore` API when available or falling back to polling `document.cookie`.

This file defines constants and utility functions related to privacy levels for DOM nodes and user input within the RUM (Real User Monitoring) browser SDK. It specifies privacy attributes, class prefixes, masking characters, and elements considered private for data collection.

This file contains unit tests for the RUM session manager, verifying its functionality related to session creation, tracking, cookie storage, expiration, renewal, and session replay state determination under various configurations and conditions.

Manages privacy levels for DOM nodes and their content/attributes, determining what should be masked, ignored, or allowed during recording based on defined rules and HTML attributes. It provides functions to compute, reduce, and apply these privacy levels to ensure sensitive information is handled appropriately.
This file contains tests for the `trackingConsentContext` module, ensuring that telemetry is correctly discarded or allowed based on the user's tracking consent status.

This file provides utilities for testing network requests by intercepting and mocking browser APIs like `fetch`, `sendBeacon`, and `XMLHttpRequest` within a test environment, recording outgoing requests, and allowing custom responses.

This file defines and types the `createHooks` function, which is used to instantiate a set of abstract hooks for the SDK, including `Assemble` and `AssembleTelemetry`. It establishes the core hook mechanism and their expected signatures.
This file provides a test utility to verify if a given callback successfully instruments a method on an object, typically used in unit tests for browser SDK instrumentation.

This file provides a utility function to disable Jasmine's default uncaught error handling. This is useful for preventing test failures when exceptions or unhandled rejections are expected to be caught within a test but Jasmine would otherwise intercept them.
Provides a mock implementation of the `ContextManager` for testing purposes, allowing easy creation of test doubles for context management.
Defines constants and type utilities for testing the core package's configuration, including exhaustive and serialized initialization configurations and key mapping types.

This file provides utilities for detecting memory leaks of event listeners in a test environment, specifically across Jasmine test specs. It overrides standard event listener methods to wrap listeners and identify if they are triggered in a different spec than where they were attached.

This file provides mock error stack traces for testing scenarios involving browser extensions within the Datadog browser SDK. It defines different stack trace formats for errors originating from the main page or from Chrome and Firefox extensions.
This file provides a utility function to mock Datadog Synthetics worker values, either by setting global window properties or by manipulating cookies, primarily for testing purposes.

This file provides a mock implementation of the FlushController interface, designed for testing purposes. It allows simulating and controlling the buffering and flushing behavior of data within the browser SDK.
Provides utility functions to mock the browser's `navigator.onLine` and `navigator.connection` properties, primarily for testing purposes.

This file provides a utility function, `createNewEvent`, to programmatically create browser `Event` objects for testing. It allows specifying event types and custom properties, and sets an internal `__ddIsTrusted` flag.

This file provides utilities to mock and capture telemetry events for testing purposes, allowing tests to inspect and control generated telemetry data. It includes functions to start a mock telemetry collection and create a fake telemetry object.

This file provides utilities for testing browser reporting mechanisms. It includes functions to mock the `ReportingObserver` API and simulate CSP violation events, allowing for controlled emulation of these browser features in a test environment.

This file provides a utility function to create and set up a mock `DatadogEventBridge` object on the window for testing purposes. It allows customizing the mock bridge's capabilities and privacy level.
This file provides utilities for testing location changes by setting up a mock location object, an observable to track changes, and a function to simulate location transitions.
Provides a mock implementation for the browser's `PerformanceObserver` API, allowing controlled testing of performance entry collection and notification behavior.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK's telemetry features, verifying the collection and reporting of errors, configurations, and usage metrics for both Logs and RUM SDKs, including scenarios like consent revocation and session initialization failures.
This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK, verifying that user, account, and global contexts are correctly propagated and included in RUM and Logs events.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the tracking consent feature in the Datadog Browser SDK, verifying its behavior for both RUM and Logs services regarding SDK initialization, event sending, and session management based on consent status.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK's data transport mechanism, specifically verifying the compression of intake requests (e.g., RUM data) and handling scenarios where compression workers fail.

This file contains end-to-end Playwright tests for the Datadog Event Bridge functionality. It verifies that various types of RUM, Logs, Telemetry, and Session Replay events are correctly sent via the event bridge.

This file contains end-to-end Playwright tests for the Datadog browser SDK, verifying how session data is stored and retrieved using cookies, local storage, and in-memory persistence under various configurations and availability conditions.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK, specifically verifying handling stack capture and source code context-based service/version attribution for RUM and Logs events in microfrontend scenarios.

This file contains end-to-end Playwright tests for the Datadog Browser SDK's functionality within browser extensions. It verifies that the SDK correctly handles `allowedTrackingOrigins` configurations and edge cases when operating in an extension environment.

This file defines constants for application ID and client token, along with default RUM and Logs configurations used in end-to-end tests for the Datadog browser SDK. It sets specific sample rates to 100% to ensure test stability.
This file provides helper functions for managing browser session cookies within Playwright end-to-end tests, including renewing, expiring, and finding session states.

This file provides utility functions and configurations for setting up various page environments in end-to-end tests, including different ways to load and initialize Datadog SDKs (e.g., async, bundled, npm, React, or worker setups).
This file provides a framework for creating and running end-to-end tests for the Datadog browser SDK using Playwright, allowing for custom configurations, server setups, and test environments.

This file defines types for various data intake requests (logs, RUM, replay) and provides an `IntakeRegistry` class. This class collects and organizes these requests, offering utility methods to filter and access specific types of events or segments, primarily for end-to-end testing.

This file extends the global `Window` interface to include Datadog-specific objects (`DD_LOGS`, `DD_RUM`, `DD_SOURCE_CODE_CONTEXT`). It provides type definitions for these global variables, likely for use in end-to-end tests.
This file initializes Datadog Logs and RUM, either by calling global functions defined on the window object or directly with placeholder configurations for compatibility testing purposes.

This README describes a complex React/TypeScript Single Page Application (SPA) designed to benchmark and profile the Datadog Browser SDK, detailing its structure, performance targets, and setup instructions.
This file is the main entry point for the React application, initializing the React root and rendering the primary application component within StrictMode.

This React component provides a form for users to view and edit their settings, including fields like name, email, role, timezone, and notification preferences, with client-side validation and state management for saving.

This React component displays a list of third-party service integrations, allowing users to view their status and toggle their connection state. It simulates API calls for connecting and disconnecting integrations.
This React component provides a user interface for managing a team, including adding new members with form validation, updating existing members' roles, and removing members from the team list.

This directory is intended to store static or public data specifically for the 'react-heavy-spa' test application. It likely holds mock or sample data used during the testing of the Datadog browser SDK within a complex React environment.
This file overrides the native `Node.prototype.appendChild` method, allowing for its interception or instrumentation, likely for testing purposes within a browser extension context.
This file serves as the entry point for a React test application, rendering the main `App` component into the DOM. It initializes the React application for the Datadog browser-sdk's test environment.
This file defines data structures for products and categories, and provides a function to fetch product data. It serves as the data layer for product information within the application.
This file automates the process of measuring and comparing CPU performance between a local branch and its base branch using Datadog Synthetics tests, then formats and reports the results.

Provides enhanced functions to add and remove event listeners across various DOM targets, including features like error monitoring, IE11 compatibility, 'once' option emulation, and filtering untrusted events, while returning a function to stop listening.

This file contains unit tests for the `pageMayExitObservable`, verifying its behavior in detecting and notifying about various page exit events like `beforeunload`, page visibility changes to 'hidden', and page freezing.
This file provides a wrapped `fetch` function that uses the browser's native implementation, specifically bypassing Zone.js patching to prevent unnecessary Angular change detection cycles.
This file contains unit tests for the `addEventListener` utility, verifying its behavior with Zone.js, different event targets, and its logic for filtering untrusted events based on configuration.

This file contains unit tests for a custom 'fetch' function. It verifies that the function correctly bypasses Zone.js's `fetch` implementation and directly calls the native `window.fetch` with the provided arguments, returning its response.

This file contains unit tests for the `fetchObservable` module, which proxies the native `fetch` API to observe and track network requests. It verifies that the proxy correctly tracks various fetch outcomes like success, errors, aborted requests, and extracts request details like method, URL, and response bodies.
This file provides an observable that notifies subscribers when a web page is about to exit or become inactive, based on browser events like visibility change, freezing, or before unload.
This file provides an observable that tracks the lifecycle of `fetch` requests, capturing details before the request starts and after it resolves, including optionally reading the response body.

This file contains unit tests for the `xhrObservable` module, which is responsible for observing and tracking XMLHttpRequest (XHR) lifecycles and properties within the browser SDK. It verifies various scenarios including successful requests, different error types, aborted requests, and context enhancement.

This file instruments browser XMLHttpRequest objects to observe and report their lifecycle events (open, send, complete, abort) through an observable. It captures details like method, URL, timing, status, and request/response bodies for tracking XHR activity.
This file provides utilities for monitoring and collecting synchronous errors from functions and method calls, allowing a custom error handler to be registered and debug logging to be enabled.
This test file verifies the functionality of `createHandlingStack`, ensuring it generates a stack trace that excludes internal function calls and only includes relevant user-defined calls.

This file provides functions to compute and normalize stack traces from various browser error formats (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Windows), handling cross-browser inconsistencies and custom error reporting.

This file provides a collection of example exception objects, mimicking various browser and environment stack trace formats. It serves as a helper for testing or developing functionality related to parsing and handling errors from different JavaScript runtimes.

This file defines enumerations for various types of resources (e.g., document, XHR, fetch, image) and request types used within the browser SDK, primarily for categorization and tracking network activity.

This file contains unit tests for the error utility functions within the Datadog Browser SDK. It verifies the correct formatting of various error types, extraction of file information from stack traces, and the flattening of error cause chains.

This file provides utilities for processing and transforming various types of JavaScript errors, including non-Error objects, into a standardized `RawError` format. It handles computing stack traces, extracting error context, and flattening error causes.
This file defines interfaces, types, and enums for representing and categorizing errors within the Datadog Browser SDK, including their causes, sources, and handling status.
This file defines TypeScript interfaces and types for browser-related reports, specifically for deprecation and intervention reports, including their common structure and specific body content.

This file contains unit tests for the `reportObservable` module, verifying its ability to capture and process different types of browser reports, including deprecation, intervention, and CSP violations.

This file contains unit tests for utility functions in `extensionUtils` that handle browser extension-related logic, such as identifying extension URLs and unsupported extension environments from error stacks.
This file contains unit tests for the `createIdentityEncoder` function and its associated methods, ensuring it behaves correctly as an identity encoder.
Tests the `startBufferingData` function, ensuring it correctly buffers and emits runtime errors through an observable mechanism.
This file defines types and a function for buffering runtime errors, using a `BufferedObservable` to store them with a specified limit.
This file defines the available Datadog intake site domains and related configurations, including specific intake site constants and URL parameters used for data ingestion.

This file contains unit tests for the `endpointBuilder` module, verifying its functionality in constructing various data intake endpoints with correct query parameters, proxy settings, PCI compliance, and source configurations.

This file defines interfaces and utility functions for configuring the transport layer of the Datadog browser SDK. It computes endpoint builders for various data types and handles replica configurations.

This file contains unit tests for the transport configuration module, specifically verifying how intake endpoints are computed based on various parameters and testing the detection of Datadog intake URLs.

This file provides utilities for constructing the full intake endpoint URL and its query parameters for the Datadog SDK. It handles various configurations like proxies, intake sites, and specific tracking types to prepare requests for data transmission.

This file contains unit tests for the `flushController` module, verifying its behavior in triggering flush events based on various conditions like page exit, session expiration, and limits on message count, bytes, and duration.

This file contains unit tests for the httpRequest module, verifying its functionality related to sending HTTP requests using various strategies (fetch, fetchKeepAlive, sendBeacon), handling retries, fallbacks, and reporting request events.
This file provides the `createBatch` function, which manages a collection of messages, serializes, encodes, and flushes them in batches using an encoder and an HTTP request controller.
This file serves as a barrel file for the `transport` module, re-exporting types and functions related to HTTP requests, event bridging, batching, and flush control mechanisms.

This file contains unit tests for the `batch` module, verifying its functionality for adding, upserting, and flushing messages under various conditions, including message size limits, synchronous/asynchronous encoding, and page exit scenarios.

This file defines interfaces and utility functions for interacting with a `DatadogEventBridge`, which facilitates communication between JavaScript environments (e.g., webviews) and a native application or host by sending events and checking bridge capabilities and host permissions.

This file defines a `FlushController` responsible for determining when a batch of pending data should be flushed, based on various triggers like page exit, session expiry, duration, total bytes, or message count limits. It manages the state of pending messages and notifies observers when a flush is needed.

This file contains unit tests for the `sendWithRetryStrategy` function, which manages sending network requests with retry logic, bandwidth limitations, and payload queueing. It verifies how requests are sent, queued, and retried under various conditions.
This file implements a robust retry strategy for sending data payloads, managing network requests with bandwidth monitoring, exponential backoff, and a queue for failed or deferred submissions.

This file contains unit tests for the event bridge module, verifying its functionality related to WebView host validation, event serialization, privacy level retrieval, and capability checks within the Datadog browser SDK.

This file provides a utility for sending data payloads via HTTP requests to configured endpoints, implementing various browser-specific strategies like `fetch`, `fetch` with `keepalive`, and `sendBeacon`, along with retry mechanisms and event observability.
This file contains unit tests for the `formDataTransport` module. It verifies that the transport correctly sends events and attachments as FormData objects.

This file contains unit tests for the `datacenter` module, specifically verifying its ability to fetch, cache, and correctly authenticate when retrieving datacenter metadata from a runtime-metadata-service.

This file exports a function that sends performance metrics or log data to Datadog's log intake API. It formats the data with relevant metadata like service, environment, and SDK version before sending.
Defines the types for a Deflate web worker, including the actions it can receive, the responses it can send, and an enum for various data stream IDs used in the deflation process.
This file serves as the main entry point for the deflate domain's type definitions within the core package, re-exporting all types from `./deflate.types`.
This README file provides an overview of the `worker` package within the Datadog browser SDK, specifically detailing its function as a web worker.
This file serves as the main entry point for a web worker in the Datadog browser SDK. It initializes and starts the worker's core functionality.

This file implements a Web Worker responsible for compressing data using the Deflate algorithm, handling messages from the main thread to initialize, write, or reset compression streams, and returning compressed data or error responses.

This file contains unit tests for the `startWorker` function, which manages deflate compression within a web worker. It verifies the worker's ability to compress data across multiple streams, reset stream states, and handle errors effectively.

This file contains utilities and data structures for the DEFLATE compression algorithm, adapted and trimmed from the Pako library. It defines constants, arrays, and functions necessary for bit-level operations and Huffman tree generation used in DEFLATE compression.

This file declares types and interfaces for a Deflate compression utility, including the `Deflate` class for incremental data compression, related constants, and a string-to-buffer conversion utility.

This file contains unit tests for the `startDeflateWorker` function, covering its behavior during worker creation, initialization, reuse, and various error handling scenarios such as CSP issues, timeouts, and other exceptions.

This file serves as an entry point for deflate-related utilities within the RUM (Real User Monitoring) package. It exports functions for creating a deflate encoder and managing a deflate worker, likely used for compressing data before transmission.

This file defines a `DeflateEncoder` that uses a Web Worker to asynchronously compress data streams. It manages the state of the compression process, including pending writes and accumulating compressed output.

This file manages the lifecycle of a web worker (DeflateWorker) responsible for data compression/deflation. It handles the worker's creation, asynchronous initialization, error reporting, and state management throughout its operation.
This file defines types and enums for raw telemetry events, including specific types for configuration and usage, used within the browser SDK.

This file defines the TypeScript types for various telemetry events (error, debug, configuration, usage) within the Datadog Browser SDK. It serves as a schema for the different kinds of telemetry data collected and sent.
This file serves as the main entry point for the telemetry domain, re-exporting core telemetry types, services, metrics, and utility functions for the browser SDK.

This file contains unit tests for the telemetry module, verifying its functionality for collecting, formatting, and sampling various types of telemetry events like errors, configurations, usage, and metrics.

This file is responsible for initializing, collecting, and transporting telemetry events (including logs, errors, configuration, and metrics) for the Datadog Browser SDK. It manages telemetry event creation, sampling, and sending to the appropriate endpoints.
This file contains unit tests for the `checkTelemetryErrors` function, ensuring it correctly identifies and reports telemetry errors in different scenarios and handles unexpected API responses.

Real User Monitoring (RUM).description: Captures and analyzes user interactions, application performance, and errors to provide comprehensive insights into the end-user experience and identify frontend performance bottlenecks.

files.description: This README provides an overview of the Datadog Browser RUM React integration package, detailing its purpose and linking to further documentation.

This file provides a utility function `appendComponent` for React testing. It renders a given React component into a detached DOM element and includes cleanup logic, ensuring proper test environment setup and teardown.
This file provides backward compatibility for `performance.measure` in old browsers by modifying its parameters to prevent errors from unsupported `measureOptions`.

files.description: This file contains unit tests for the console observable module, verifying its ability to capture, format, and process logs and errors from various console API methods while maintaining original console behavior.

This file provides an observable interface for browser console API calls (e.g., console.log, console.error), intercepting and formatting them into structured log events. It specifically handles console errors by transforming them into `RawError` objects.
This file initializes and configures Datadog logging for the browser extension's background script, setting a global context to distinguish background logs.

This React component renders a responsive pie chart using Recharts to visualize the distribution of log levels. It displays a loading state while data is being fetched and customizes the chart's appearance with specific colors and tooltips.
This React component displays the detailed view of a single log entry, allowing users to inspect its properties, view the raw JSON, and copy its content to the clipboard.

This file defines the `LogsExplorer` React component, which provides an interface for fetching, filtering, searching, and displaying log entries. It includes components for a search bar, filter sidebar, log table, and log details view.
This file defines a reusable React `SearchBar` component that provides an input field with a search icon, a clear button, and debounces user input before calling the `onChange` handler.

This file defines a React component, `LogTable`, which displays a virtualized list of log entries in a table format. It includes functionality for formatting log details, selecting individual logs, and handling an empty state.

This React component provides an interactive sidebar for filtering log data. It allows users to filter logs by levels, services, and hosts, and includes collapsible sections and checkbox lists for selection.

Session Replay & Profiling.description: Provides visual replays of user sessions to understand user behavior and diagnose issues, combined with JavaScript execution profiling to identify and resolve complex performance problems.

files.description: This file provides utility functions for parsing and extracting data from replay payloads for testing purposes. It allows reading segment data and metadata from network payloads in RUM tests.
This file provides a default, no-operation (noop) implementation of the ShadowRootsController for use in tests. It acts as a test helper to mock the ShadowRootsController interface.

This file provides a test helper function, `createRecordingScopeForTesting`, to easily create and configure `RecordingScope` instances for unit testing purposes within the RUM browser SDK. It allows injecting custom configurations and mock shadow root controller functions.
This file defines TypeScript interfaces for performance profiling and testing scenarios within the Datadog browser SDK, including web vitals and other resource metrics.

This file sets up and starts an HTTPS server for performance testing, serving specific application builds (e.g., React apps) and including middleware for profiling and self-signed certificate generation.
This file provides utilities to start and stop network profiling for a Playwright page, tracking total upload and download byte sizes.

This file provides a central function to start multiple types of performance profiling (CPU, memory, network, and web vitals) for a Playwright test. It returns functions to take measurements during profiling and stop all profiling, gathering the collected metrics.

This file provides a utility function to format and display performance metrics (e.g., memory, CPU, web vitals) in a console table. It helps visualize profiling results for different scenarios and SDK versions.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog browser SDK's session recorder, verifying its ability to capture full snapshots, incremental mutations (DOM changes, character data, attributes), and user interactions like mouse movements, including privacy obfuscation rules.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK's recorder, specifically verifying its ability to accurately capture and report layout and visual viewport properties, including during pinch zoom and scroll events. It ensures measurements like window dimensions and scroll positions are correctly recorded despite browser-specific behaviors.

This file contains end-to-end tests for the Datadog Browser SDK's session replay recorder, specifically verifying its ability to correctly capture and serialize DOM events, mutations, privacy levels, and full snapshots within Shadow DOM environments.

Defines TypeScript types and interfaces for browser-specific Session Replay data, including segments, records, and various types of snapshot and incremental data for capturing user interactions and UI changes.

This file defines constants and corresponding types for various entities used in session replay, such as different record types, node types, change types, playback states, incremental sources, and interaction types. It standardizes numeric identifiers for these components within the session replay data.
This file contains unit tests for the `replayStats` module, which manages and tracks statistics related to RUM (Real User Monitoring) replay segments and records within the browser SDK.

This file manages and tracks replay statistics (segments, records, and raw data size) for different views. It provides functions to add and retrieve these statistics, while also maintaining a limited history of view statistics.

This file contains unit tests for the `startSegmentTelemetry` function, verifying its behavior in collecting and reporting metrics for replay segment network requests under various conditions, including success, failure, full snapshots, and incremental mutations.

This file defines the `Segment` interface and `createSegment` function, responsible for aggregating browser records, managing segment metadata and serialization statistics, and encoding the data into a segment that can be flushed.

This file contains unit tests for the segment collection mechanism in the Datadog Browser RUM SDK, specifically focusing on how segments are started, records are added, and various conditions (like page exit, view change, byte limits, and duration limits) trigger segment flushing and new segment creation.
This file manages the collection and flushing of replay segments for session replays, orchestrating their creation, data accumulation, and submission based on various events and size/time limits.

This file serves as an entry point for segment collection functionalities within the RUM browser SDK. It exports core segment management, byte limits, replay payload types, and telemetry setup for browser segments.

This file contains unit tests for the `segment` module, verifying its functionality related to adding records, flushing segments, handling metadata, and tracking serialization statistics within the browser RUM SDK.
This file starts the telemetry collection for replay segments, gathering metrics like size, serialization duration, and request outcomes, and reporting them to Datadog.

This file defines TypeScript types and interfaces for browser profiling data within the Datadog Browser SDK. It includes schemas for profile events, common properties, profiler traces, and associated RUM context.
This file provides the RUM Profiler API, responsible for initializing, starting, and stopping the RUM profiler based on session tracking, sampling, and browser compatibility checks.
This file is responsible for lazily loading the RUM profiler module. It dynamically imports the profiler and includes error handling for potential loading failures.
Checks if the browser's Profiler API is available and supported. This determines if client-side profiling features can be utilized.
Manages a profiling context that is injected into RUM VIEW and LONG_TASK events, providing methods to set and retrieve the current profiling state.
This file contains unit tests for the `getNumberOfSamples` function. It verifies that the function correctly counts samples that have a defined stack ID within a given array of profiler samples.
This file provides a utility function to count the number of non-idle samples from a profiler's collected samples.

This file defines TypeScript interfaces for a JavaScript self-profiling API, including structures for profiling data like frames, stacks, samples, and traces, as well as the Profiler object itself, based on the WICG specification.
This file serves as an index for re-exporting all type definitions related to profiling within the RUM SDK, consolidating them for easier access.
This file provides mocked `ProfilerTrace` objects, including an empty trace and a trace with generated data, for use in testing the profiling functionality.
Assembles the profiling payload for browser RUM, converting raw profiler traces into a structured event and associated `wall-time.json` data for transport to Datadog.

This file provides a stub implementation for the ProfilerApi, returning an object with no-operation functions. It is used when the full profiling functionality is not enabled or required, for example, in a 'slim' build.
This file provides a no-operation (noop) implementation of the ProfilerApi, primarily used for testing or when profiling is disabled. It ensures all API methods perform no actions.
This file provides functions to start, stop, and take intermediate measurements for CPU profiling using the Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) via a CDPSession, accumulating total CPU consumption.
This file serves as a barrel for the RUM (Real User Monitoring) package's type definitions and constants, consolidating and re-exporting types related to session replay and profiling.

This file is responsible for lazily loading the session recorder module dynamically and handling potential script loading errors during the process. It uses dynamic imports with a specified webpack chunk name for the recorder.

This file contains unit tests for the `lazyLoadRecorder` function, focusing on its behavior when the recorder module fails to load. It verifies that console errors are displayed and specific telemetry metrics are reported without generating telemetry errors in such failure scenarios.

This file defines a strategy for managing the lifecycle of a session recorder, coordinating its start, stop, and status based on RUM session events and configuration. It handles the asynchronous loading of the recorder and its dependencies.
This file contains unit tests for the `startRecording` function, which is responsible for initiating and managing the recording of user sessions in the Datadog RUM browser SDK.
This file contains unit tests for the `recorderApi` module, verifying its initialization and behavior related to starting and stopping recording based on session state and configuration.

This file provides the core API for managing session replay recording in the Datadog browser SDK, including starting/stopping recording, handling compression workers, and integrating with RUM (Real User Monitoring) lifecycle.
This file initializes and manages the recording of user sessions for RUM replay, handling data collection, segmentation, and transmission either directly or via an event bridge.

This file defines a 'pre-start' strategy for session replay, tracking early manual start/stop calls and determining whether session replay should begin immediately based on these actions and configuration.
This file provides functionality to collect and send telemetry metrics related to the recorder's initialization process, tracking durations and outcomes like success or failure.

This file contains tests for the `getSessionReplayLink` function, verifying its behavior in generating session replay URLs under various conditions, such as different session states, replay statuses, and browser support.
This file provides a function `startRecordBridge` that sets up an event bridge for sending browser records, associating them with the active view for recording purposes.

This file contains unit tests for the `startRecorderInitTelemetry` module, verifying that it correctly collects and reports telemetry metrics related to the recorder initialization process under various scenarios.

This file provides a function to generate a Datadog Session Replay URL. It includes logic to determine the current session and view context, as well as an 'errorType' indicating why a replay might not be available (e.g., browser not supported, session not tracked, replay sampled out, or not started).

This file initializes and manages the recording of user interactions and DOM mutations within the browser, orchestrating various trackers to capture session replay data. It serves as the primary entry point for starting and stopping the recording process.

This file defines the `RecordingScope` interface and its creation, which encapsulates the state and ID management utilities necessary for a single, consistent stream of session replay records within the Datadog RUM SDK.
This file defines a utility function to generate a Session Replay URL specifically for the RUM Slim package, leveraging the core RUM SDK's URL generation logic.

This file contains unit tests for the `getSessionReplayLink` function, specifically verifying that it generates a session replay link with a 'slim-package' error type when called from the RUM slim package.
This file provides a stub implementation of the recorder API for the RUM slim build, primarily offering no-op functions and a placeholder for retrieving the session replay link.
This file provides a 'no-operation' (noop) implementation of the RecorderApi interface, used as a placeholder or mock when the actual session recording functionality is not active or available.
This file provides utility functions to construct URLs for Datadog session replays and the main Datadog site, based on configuration and contextual information.
This file defines TypeScript types for callbacks related to emitting browser records and serialization statistics within the RUM SDK.

This file provides internal API functions to take full snapshots of the document or specific DOM nodes, generating records and serialized representations similar to what the browser SDK produces for session replay.

This file defines utilities for assigning and managing unique numerical IDs to different types of objects (like events, DOM nodes, and stylesheets) within the RUM browser SDK, using either `Map` or `WeakMap` for storage.

This file contains unit tests for the internal API functions `takeFullSnapshot` and `takeNodeSnapshot` within the RUM SDK. It verifies that these functions correctly capture and serialize the DOM state for session recording, including handling of meta information, focus, full snapshots, and shadow DOM.

This file contains unit tests for the `ItemIds` utility, verifying its functionality for assigning and managing unique identifiers for various types of items like events, DOM nodes, strings, and stylesheets.

This file contains unit tests for the `startFullSnapshots` function, verifying its behavior in capturing and emitting full snapshot records (Meta, Focus, FullSnapshot/Change, VisualViewport) upon initialization and view changes, considering different experimental feature settings.

This file is responsible for taking full snapshots of the DOM and browser state. It initiates the snapshot process on initial load and subsequent view creations, serializing the document into a full snapshot record.
Defines interfaces and utility functions for tracking, updating, and aggregating serialization-related performance metrics like CSS text size and serialization duration.
Tests the `InsertionCursor` class, which manages the current position within a hierarchical structure to determine how new nodes should be inserted (e.g., as a root, child, or sibling).

This file contains unit tests for the `serializeStyleSheets` function, ensuring it correctly serializes CSSStyleSheet objects, including their rules, disabled status, and media queries, while also tracking serialization statistics.
This file defines a utility function to serialize browser-native CSSStyleSheet objects into a custom, serializable format, handling specific browser compatibility issues for recording purposes.
This file provides a function to serialize an HTML element's attribute value, applying privacy masking or censoring based on configured privacy levels and sanitizing long data URLs.

This file defines the `InsertionCursor` interface and its factory function `createRootInsertionCursor`, which are used to efficiently track and determine insertion points for nodes during change-style DOM serialization.

This file contains the `serializeDocument` function, which is responsible for serializing a browser's Document object into a format suitable for session recording and replay, typically for RUM (Real User Monitoring).
This file defines types related to the serialization of DOM nodes, including privacy levels for parent nodes and virtual attributes added during the serialization process.
This file contains unit tests for the serialization statistics utility functions, ensuring they correctly track and aggregate metrics like CSS text length and serialization duration.

This file defines transaction interfaces and functions for serializing DOM snapshots and incremental changes into session replay records. It provides mechanisms to collect records, metrics, and manage node IDs during the serialization process.

This file contains unit tests for `serializationUtils.ts`, specifically verifying the behavior of `getElementInputValue` for different HTML input types and privacy levels, and `switchToAbsoluteUrl` for converting relative CSS URLs to absolute ones.

This file provides functions to recursively serialize a DOM Node into a structured, ID-assigned object, handling different node types (elements, text, documents) and applying privacy rules to exclude or hide sensitive content.

This file provides utility functions for serializing DOM elements and their attributes, including handling input values with privacy levels, converting relative URLs to absolute URLs in CSS, and normalizing HTML tag names. It's part of the serialization process for the RUM (Real User Monitoring) SDK.

This file contains unit tests for the `serializeAttribute` function, verifying its behavior in various scenarios such as attribute truncation, masking based on privacy levels, and special handling for specific attributes like image sources and iframe srcdoc.

This file contains unit tests for the `serializeNode` function, which is responsible for converting various DOM nodes (documents, elements, attributes, etc.) into a serializable format for the Datadog RUM browser SDK. It verifies the correct serialization of different node types, attributes, and privacy levels.

This file provides functions to serialize both standard and virtual attributes of DOM elements for recording purposes, handling privacy levels, form element states, and extracting CSS content from stylesheets, including browser-specific considerations.

This file contains functions to serialize a DOM node and its children into a transaction that records changes, considering privacy levels and different node types. It is used to capture DOM modifications for replay purposes.

This file provides utility functions and predefined HTML and AST structures to assist in testing the serialization of HTML documents, particularly for different privacy levels (e.g., masking, hiding) within the Datadog RUM browser SDK.

This file provides helper functions to convert a sequence of RUM browser change records into a full browser DOM snapshot. It is primarily used for testing and reconstructing the state of a web page at a given point from incremental updates.

This file provides a utility function to assemble an incremental snapshot record for browser session replay. It combines source data with additional information, a timestamp, and the record type to create a complete snapshot entry.
This file defines types and functions for tracking and managing the scroll positions of DOM elements, including special handling for the document's scrolling element.
This file contains unit tests for the `createMutationBatch` function, verifying its behavior in batching RUM mutations and processing them asynchronously after a delay or synchronously on flush.
This file contains unit tests for the browser recording module, focusing on capturing various DOM changes like stylesheet rules, full snapshots, and especially mutations and events within Shadow DOM.
Provides utility functions for handling browser events, such as determining if an event is a touch event or correctly identifying the event target, including cases involving the Shadow DOM.
This file normalizes viewport dimensions and mouse event coordinates, addressing browser inconsistencies between visual and layout viewports using the Visual Viewport API.

This file defines a utility to efficiently batch and process DOM mutations, using throttling and `requestIdleCallback` to optimize performance by delaying processing until the browser is idle or a minimum/maximum delay is met.

This file defines a `ChangeEncoder` responsible for optimizing and encoding DOM changes. It compacts changes by converting strings to references and grouping changes by type before flushing them in a predefined order.

This test file validates the functionality of the `ChangeEncoder`, which serializes and groups various types of DOM mutations and other events. It specifically tests how the encoder handles string conversion to IDs, manages a string table, aggregates changes, and ensures correct dependency ordering upon flushing.

This file serves as a barrel export for various tracking functionalities within the RUM (Real User Monitoring) recording domain. It aggregates and re-exports modules responsible for tracking user interactions (e.g., mouse, scroll, input), DOM mutations, viewport changes, and other relevant events.

This file tracks modifications to CSS stylesheets, including the addition and removal of rules in both top-level stylesheets and nested grouping rules (e.g., media queries). It instruments native DOM methods to capture these changes and emit them as incremental snapshots for recording purposes.

This file observes DOM mutations (additions, removals, attribute, and text changes) using a MutationObserver, buffers them, and serializes them into incremental snapshots for recording browser activity.

This file implements the Session Replay tab for a Datadog developer extension, allowing users to view and interact with session replays within an iframe. It handles the initialization, state management, and controls for the replay player, including options to force full snapshots and download recorded data.

This file defines TypeScript types for message passing and data structures used in a session replay player, facilitating communication between the main application and sandboxed rendering environments.
Initializes and manages an embedded session replay player within an iframe, handling record buffering, state updates, and communication with the replay sandbox.
